page.title: 14RELIGION - NASH AREA
page.content: 1. CHURCH OF ENGLAND - All Saints, Nash (Parish of Nash with Thornton) built 1857 - St Mary, Beachampton (Parish of Beachampton), original Church 14th century. These 2 parishes together with that of Thornborough form a United Benefice (Rector: Rev SFB Heywood). At least one service is held each Sunday at each Church, the average congregation being approximately 10% of the population. 2. NON-CONFORMIST - Nash Strict Baptist Chapel (built 1798). Services were suspended in 1985. Wood End Mission Hall, Nash founded 1950. Services held 2.30pm and 6.30pm. 3. A number of villagers travel to churches in Buckingham, Bletchley, Winslow, Whaddon or Thornborough (where there are other denominaions).
